page.title: 01Auckley-A changing village
page.content: {Auckley}was called ALEHELEU in the original Domesday book.Since then it has changed its name several times.In 1294 it was known as ALKELAY.By 1327 this became ALKESLEYE,while in Victorian times it was called AWKLEY. It is only recently,since the 1960's that its present spelling was adapted as the correct one.This seems to originate from the Scandinavian, Alka meaning sea-bird and lea meaning a clearing or meadow. Before the recent expansion in the 1970's,{Auckley}was basically a rural community.Little remains of this way of life today,although one family in the village have farmed for probably 100 years.{Auckley}now serves as a commuter village for Doncaster and to a lesser extent R.A.F.Finningley.
